void iField_createTensorField ( const iField_Instance  instance,
iField_DomainHandle  domain_handle,
int  precision,
iField_DFuncKernel  dfunc_kernel,

const char *  name,
iField_TensorHandle *  tensor_handle,
int *  err,
const int  name_len 
)

Create a tensor field from a template, distribution functions, units, and domain.

Parameters:
instance  [in] iField instance handle
domain_handle  [in] The domain this field is defined on.
precision  [in] Is this data single precision, double precision, etc? (enum)
dfunc_kernel  [in] A function callback for converting spatial coordinates into the value for a distribution function.
tt_handle  [in] The tensor template specifies whether this is, for instance, a velocity, or a temperature, or a stress.
units_handle  [in] SI, cgs, slugs-ft-sec, or user-defined.
name  [in] A string giving a name for this tensor.
tensor_handle  [out] The new tensor field.
err  [out] Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)
name_len  [in] Length of name string.

void iField_createTensorFields ( const iField_Instance  instance,
iField_DomainHandle  domain_handle,
int  precision,
iField_DFuncKernel  dfunc_kernel,
iField_TensorTemplateHandle *  tt_handles,
iField_UnitsHandle *  units_handles,
char **  names,
const int  num_tensors,
iField_TensorHandle *  compound_handle,
iField_TensorHandle **  tensor_handles,
int *  tensor_handles_allocated,
int *  tensor_handles_size,
int *  err,
const int *  name_len 
)

Create multiple tensor fields from a template, distribution.

functions, units, and coordinate system. The concept this multi-field create method provides are... 1. hint to implementation of storing them together, 2. possible convenience for caller to set all dofs together 3. storage is predictable/computable because all fields obey properties that make this possible. This also has implications in array-based methods of getting/setting dofs as well. Have to look into Fortran size requirements here! Restrictions: 1. The resulting component fields can be evaluated and set/getDOF'ed individually, but can't be destroyed individually. 2. All fields must use the same dfunc and data storage precision. 3. Units need not be consistent between fields, as they're each defined separately.

Parameters:
instance  [in] iField instance handle
domain_handle  [in] The domain this field is defined on.
precision  [in] Is this data single precision, double precision, etc? (enum)
dfunc_kernel  [in] A function callback for converting spatial coordinates into the value for a distribution function.
tt_handles  [in] One tensor template for each tensor to be created.
units_handles  [in] Units for each tensor to be created.
names  [in] An array of strings giving names of tensors (one more name than templates, so that the compound will also have a name).
num_tensors  [in] How many new tensors?
compound_handle  [out] A separate handle for the collection of tensors.
tensor_handles  [in,out] The new tensor fields.
tensor_handles_allocated  [in,out] Allocated size of tensor handle array.
tensor_handles_size  [out] Number of tensors created and returned.
err  [out] Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)
name_len  Lengths of name strings. [CFOG

Return the component tensor fields making up a compound field.

Parameters:

tensor_handle  [in] Field to operate on.
tensor_handles  [in,out] Array of component tensor fields.
tensor_handles_allocated  [in,out] Allocated size of TF array.
tensor_handles_size  [out] Used size of TF array.
err  [out] Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)
